content:
Public stream created by Jean-Baptiste Vienney. Description:

Doing research together

@Christian Williams wrote this on pratice: our work -> thoughts on sharing ideas:

I think many people on here are interested in the idea of public research, i.e. open collaboration and knowledge sharing. we need better infrastructure for this; Joshua Meyers and I want to help in development. we'll start a conversation sometime soon.
I agree with this idea and want to propose a first research suggestion.
Go to the associate topic if you're interested.
I don’t really know how works the subscription to the stream.
It would be great to build something together as it’s done for open source softwares. I'm bored of working alone.

But please don’t use this without mentioning all the participants. An eventual paper should mention all the participants as coauthors (if by chance somebody else than me is interested by this suggestion).

We (the circle of people around and including John B, Urs, David Corfield, Todd, Toby, etc) did have the nLab/nForum for that, but over time it has ossified and also turned more into Urs' plaything, since he has been the one adding stuff unceasingly. I agree it's not the best setup. But the nLab is still a reasonable place to write stuff down, if I may say so.
I think it's a great idea in any case, however it is done.
Nathanael Arkor changed the access permissions for this stream from Public to Web-public.

Matteo Capucci (he/him) changed the posting permissions for this stream:

  • Old permissions: All stream members can post.
  • New permissions: Only organization administrators and moderators can post.
Matteo Capucci (he/him) renamed stream practice: public research to deprecated: public research.
